doc.field: Education Committee for Non-English Speaking Women photographs
Education Committee for Non-English Speaking Women photographs

Photographs documenting the work of the Education Committee for Non-English Speaking Women (renamed the Neighborhood Teachers' Association in 1927), a program that offered language and citizenship classes to foreign-born New Yorkers in areas underserved by the Board of Education. For fuller details about this item, and to request it for research, please read its catalog record, or write to printroom@nyhistory.org.
